title: Sweat Protector (koyori Ase-hajiki), 1850–1860
medium:
Medium: paper
Technique: 4-strand plaiting with 2-strand twists
provenance: Purchase from Morita Antique Textiles, Tokyo
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Vest which opens at the front; fronts connected to back by two strands. Plaited recycled paper forming hexagonal mesh. Twisted strands are knotted at the bottom and middle of each side. Recycled handwritten material reads as irregular black spots on the strands of plaited and twisted paper.
